author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...KIRK ACCELERATING NORTH-NORTHEASTWARD OVER OPEN WATERS... ...LARGE SWELLS ARE PRODUCING AN INCREASED RISK OF LIFE-THREATENING RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE U.S. EAST COAST...
summary:
...KIRK ACCELERATING NORTH-NORTHEASTWARD OVER OPEN WATERS... ...LARGE SWELLS ARE PRODUCING AN INCREASED RISK OF LIFE-THREATENING RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE U.S. EAST COAST...
 As of 5:00 AM AST Sun Oct 6
 the center of Kirk was located near 33.5, -49.0
 with movement NNE at 23 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 957 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 105 mph.
